sentences.sContent: The  radiation  radius of the  radioactive  radium  radiator in the  stadium is  variable.
sentences.sContent_eng: The radiation radius of the radioactive radium radiator in the stadium is variable.
sentences.sCn: 放射性的镭暖气装置的辐射半径在体育场是易变的。

sentences.sContent: Madame Curie was the physicist with expertise in chemistry that, in 1898, discovered the radioactive substances of radium and polonium in Paris, France.
sentences.sContent_eng: Madame Curie was the physicist with expertise in chemistry that, in 1898, discovered the radioactive substances of radium and polonium in Paris, France.
sentences.sCn: 居里夫人是一位具有化学专门知识的物理学家。 1898年，她在法国巴黎发现了放射性物质的镭和钋。

trans.tranOther: a white metal that is  radioactive  and is used in the treatment of diseases such as  cancer  . It is a chemical  element  : symbol Ra
